summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Final consumption expenditure in million euros, with a total of 10 data points.
Overall Final consumption expenditure in million euros has decreased over the Year.

Final consumption expenditure in million euros is gradually decreasing from 2008 to 2009, roughly constant from 2009 to 2013, slightly increasing from 2013 to 2014, roughly constant from 2014 to 2015, slightly decreasing from 2015 to 2016, and lastly slightly increasing from 2016 to 2017.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.

This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Final consumption expenditure in million euros, with a total of 10 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2008 to 2011.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2013 to 2015.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2016 to 2017.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2015 to 2016.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2012 to 2013.
